actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Friday, February 14, 2025,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Friday, February 14, 2025, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Con.Res. 7 (Sen. Graham):
        An original concurrent resolution setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2025 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2026 through 2034.

        -- Motion to proceed to consideration of measure agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 47. Record Vote Number: 58 


        -- Measure laid before Senate by motion.

PN11-9:
        Howard Lutnick, of New York, to be Secretary of Commerce

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 45. Record Vote Number: 57 



 PN12-35:
        Kashyap Patel, of Nevada, to be Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation for a term of ten years

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 48 - 45. Record Vote Number: 56 


        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.
Under the authority of the order of today, at  8:26 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Mr. Curtis in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
